title.narrative: IMMUNIZATION

description.narrative: Strengthened capacities for equitable provision of quality immunization services for children, especially for the most vulnerable and excluded groups, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Immunization, Immunization (Covid), Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, an increased number of young boys and girls, including hard-to-reach children, Roma children and children with disabilities have access to quality health services including IECD

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened capacities for equitable provision of quality immunization services for children, especially for the most vulnerableand excluded groups

description.narrative: Through various UNICEF-supported initiatives, such as technical support for the development of evidence on the barriers to immunization and action plans, programmes for catch-up immunization, support to risk communication in immunization, a social media blog, support to COVID-19 vaccine deployment and a cold chain assessment, government partners know how to improve immunization in Bosnia and Herzegovina and parents have evidence-based information about vaccines. | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/01/2021

title.narrative: Number of health professionals who gathered knowledge on latest development in field of immunization(47078)
